page.title: 18Population
page.content: The Post Master at Storth assesses the population of the entire village at 700, with 200 receiving State Retirement Pension and 200 Child Allowance. He considers that owner-occupied houses of the managerial/executive kind dominate, together with retirement homes. Workers travel mainly to Kendal and Lancaster. Unemployment is negligible, but young people normally leave the village to find work. The main source of employment for men is the local quarry. Approximately 18 persons are employed with small traders or in the hotels. The Post Office is also newsagent - with the 'Daily Telegraph' having major sales. A private car is almost essential. The Arnside-Kendal bus route is along the Promenade.
